name: MCC East Bay
mission: Join us in making a difference by donating today and helping us continue our vital work in serving the community.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 39/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish operating-reserve levels and adopt a board-approved reserve policy (typically 3-12 months for most nonprofits).

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 2 members

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Community Center - East Bay shows strong alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mcceastbay.org/zakat (Source: https://mcceastbay.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The organization's mission focuses on the emergence of an American Muslim identity.
The charity operates a Zakat program following specific asnaf categories and is Zakat-eligible.
The organization offers various donation options and giving methods for community support.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a moderate overall score of 49/100, reflecting a strong cultural and religious alignment for Muslim donors offset by a significant lack of transparent financial and impact data.
areas_for_improvement: Limited publicly available financial data and third-party verification
Low data confidence score due to missing financial metrics in current reporting
Need for increased transparency regarding program cost-effectiveness and impact metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 39/50 is high, as the organization directly addresses urgent humanitarian needs and provides a high degree of fit for donors prioritizing Zakat-eligible causes [2][4]. The mission focuses on building a cohesive American Muslim identity, which resonates strongly with the target donor demographic [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The impact score of 15/50 is considered low due to a lack of third-party verification and missing data regarding the cost per beneficiary [1]. While the organization provides direct services such as a food pantry and Zakat distribution, there is limited evidence available to evaluate the long-term effectiveness of these programs [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim Community Center – East Bay serves as a vital hub for fostering an American Muslim identity through comprehensive social services and religious guidance.
strengths: Maintains a transparent Zakat policy aligned with traditional asnaf categories
Offers diverse community programs including a food pantry and vehicle assistance
High alignment for donors seeking to support humanitarian causes within an American Muslim context
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim Community Center – East Bay (MCC East Bay) is a religious organization dedicated to the emergence of an American Muslim identity [1]. The center provides essential community support through a dedicated food pantry, a car donation program, and a structured Zakat distribution system [2].
